name: 1987 Pop Music Hits, Part II Quiz | 1980s Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Hey, pretty baby with the high heels on
You give me fever like I've never, ever known..."

Which 1987 single by Michael Jackson opened with the above lyrics?
questions.correct: The Way You Make Me Feel
options: I Just Can't Stop loving You
questions.explanation:
The Way You Make Me Feel.

	In November 1987, Michael Jackson released a single called "The Way You Make Me Feel", a song which described "high heels" and a "fever." This tune went to the top of the U.S. Billboard charts in late 1987. It was the third single from Jackson's album "Bad" to achieve success in the USA. The singles "I Just Can't Stop Loving You" and "Bad" preceded "The Way You Make Me Feel" on the Top 40 singles charts. "P.Y.T." was released in 1983.

questions.text: In 1987, the song "I Just Died in Your Arms" became a number one hit for the band Cutting _______.
questions.explanation:
Crew.

	The British-based band Cutting Crew achieved success in 1987 with the song "I Just Died in Your Arms." This tune was released in the USA in March 1987, and it rose to the number one position on the Billboard singles charts. Nick Van Eade was the lead vocalist for Cutting Crew. He sang, "I, I just died in your arms tonight / It must have been something you said..."

questions.text: In 1987, a group called Club Nouveau topped the U.S. singles charts with "Lean On Me." Which singer had a hit with this song during the 1970s?
questions.explanation:
Bill Withers.

	In April 1972, Bill Withers released a song called "Lean On Me." This soulful tune rose to the top of the U.S. Billboard singles charts. In February 1987, a band from California named Club Nouveau released an uptempo version of this Bill Withers, and it also reached the top of the U.S. Billboard charts. These lyrics comprised the song's chorus: "Lean on me, when you're not strongAnd I'll be your friend, I'll help you carry onFor it won't be long 'til I'm gonna needSomebody to lean on..."

questions.text:
"And we begin to rock steady
Steady rockin' all night long
And we begin to rock steady
Rockin' 'til the break of dawn..."

Which group reached the top ten of the U.S. singles charts in 1987 with the above lyrics?
questions.explanation:
The Whispers.

	The song "Rock Steady" was recorded by a group called The Whispers. This band was formed in Los Angeles in the late 1960s and featured the smooth vocals of Scotty Scott. "Rock Steady" was released in June 1987, and it climbed to the number seven spot on the U.S. Billboard singles charts.

questions.text: Which veteran singer had a U.S. hit in 1987 with "Just to See Her"?
questions.explanation:
Smokey Robinson.

	Veteran soul singer Smokey Robinson returned to the Top Ten of the U.S. singles charts in the spring of 1987 with his song "Just to See Her." This tune was released in March of '87, and it eventually moved up to the number eight position on the Billboard charts. Robinson won the 1988 Grammy Award for Best Male R&B Vocal Performance with "Just to See Her." Robinson sang these lyrics: "I would do anything, I would go anywhereThere's nothing I wouldn't doJust to see her again..."

questions.text: Which 1987 song by the group Swing Out Sister became a top ten hit single in the U.S.?
questions.explanation:
Breakout.

	In 1987, a British group from Manchester named Swing Out Sister hit the U.S. singles charts with a song called "Breakout." This tune featured the lead vocals of Corinne Drewery and an upbeat, brass-dominated melody. In the USA, "Breakout" was released in August 1987, and it rose to the number six position on the Billboard charts. Drewery sang these lyrics: "Don't stop to askNow you've found a break to make at lastYou've got to find a way, say what you want to sayBreakout..."

questions.text: The song "Alone" became a 1987 number one U.S. hit single for the group Heart. This group consisted of Ann and Nancy ___________.
questions.explanation:
Wilson.

	Sisters Ann and Nancy Wilson hailed from Seattle and were the most important members of the group Heart. In May 1987, the Wilson sisters released the power ballad "Alone", and this song peaked at the number one spot on the U.S. Billboard charts. Ann Wilson supplied the lead vocals on this track. She asked this question, "How do I get you alone?"

questions.text: In 1987, Chris de Burgh achieved success with a song called "The Lady in ______."
questions.explanation:
Red.

	Chris de Burgh was born in Buenos Aires, Argentina, but he grew up in Ireland. In 1986, de Burgh released an album called "Into the Light" which contained the song "The Lady in Red." This tune was popular in the U.K. in the summer of 1986. "The Lady in Red" was released in the USA in February '87, and it eventually reached the number three position on the Billboard charts. "The Lady in Red" featured these words: "The lady in red is dancing with me, cheek to cheekThere's nobody here, it's just you and me..."

questions.text:
Please complete the lyrics below. They come from a 1987 hit single by the group Fleetwood Mac:

"Tell me lies, tell me _______ little lies..."
questions.explanation:
Sweet.

	"Tell me lies, tell me sweet little lies." With these words, Christine McVie and Fleetwood Mac struck gold in the USA in 1987 with the song "Little Lies." This song appeared on the 1987 album "Tango in the Night", and it climbed to the number four spot on the Billboard charts in the autumn of 1987. The group sang these lyrics: "Tell me lies, tell me sweet little liesOh, no no, you can't disguiseTell me lies..."

questions.text: Which group from California reached the top of the U.S. pop charts in 1987 with a song called "La Bamba"?
questions.explanation:
Los Lobos.

	In the summer of 1987, the group Los Lobos ("Wolves") climbed to the top of the U.S. Billboard charts with their version of the Ritchie Valens song "La Bamba." This song was featured on the soundtrack of the 1987 movie "La Bamba", starring Lou Diamond Phillips. Some prominent members of Los Lobos included David Hidalgo (vocals, guitar), Louie Perez (vocals, drums), and Cesar Rosas (vocals, guitar). The band sang these lyrics: "Para bailar la bamba, para bailar la bambaSe necesita una poca de gracia..."
